meanings.definition: A type of protein that binds to specific carbohydrates
meanings.sent1: The lectin in the body helps to attach to sugars.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study how lectins interact with carbohydrates.
meanings.sent3: The lectin protein loves to grab onto sugars like a tiny hand.
meanings.sent4: The lectin acts like a key fitting perfectly into a sugar lock.
meanings.sent5: Imagine lectin as a tiny protein magnet attracting sugars.

meanings.definition: A substance found in plants that can cause adverse reactions in the body
meanings.sent1: Avoiding certain plants can reduce lectin intake.
meanings.sent2: Some people experience discomfort due to lectins in plants.
meanings.sent3: The lectin in the salad decided to play a prank on the digestive system.
meanings.sent4: Lectin in plants can be like a sneaky troublemaker causing reactions.
meanings.sent5: Picture lectin as a mischievous plant substance triggering reactions.
